title: How to Make Grilled Pineapple

steps.headline: Prepare the pineapple by trimming the top off, coring, and peeling it.
steps.description: Cut the pineapple into quarters, then 1 inch (2.5 cm) slices.

steps.headline: Measure and add the honey, melted butter, and lemon/lime juice in a small bowl.
Apply the marinade to the pineapple slices in two ways:
steps.description: Brush the marinade on the slices with a glazing brush. Brush on both sides. Add the marinade and pineapple slices in a large freezer bag. Place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or overnight, for best flavor.

steps.headline: Grill the slices for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until grill marks appear.
Remove the grilled pineapple slices from the grill.
steps.description: Use any remaining marinade or glaze for additional flavoring.

text: Prepare the pineapple by trimming the top off, coring, and peeling it. Cut the pineapple into quarters, then 1 inch (2.5 cm) slices. Measure and add the honey, melted butter, and lemon/lime juice in a small bowl. Stir with a spoon. Apply the marinade to the pineapple slices in two ways: Brush the marinade on the slices with a glazing brush. Brush on both sides. Add the marinade and pineapple slices in a large freezer bag. Place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or overnight, for best flavor. Grill the slices for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until grill marks appear.  Remove the grilled pineapple slices from the grill. Use any remaining marinade or glaze for additional flavoring.
